WorkItem.Description:
You aren't able to view the chart and when the XLSX file is executed you are asked to recover it. This is due to the Title being displayed on the chart. Later Excel versions don't experience this issue.
 
The following error is logged by excel:
 
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<recoveryLog xmlns="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/spreadsheetml/2006/main"><logFileName>error003080_01.xml</logFileName><summary>Errors were detected in file 'D:\xampp\htdocs\PHPExcel1.7.7\Tests\35chartexample.xlsx'</summary><removedParts summary="Following is a list of removed parts:"><removedPart>Removed Part: /xl/drawings/drawing1.xml part.  (Drawing shape)</removedPart></removedParts></recoveryLog>

Comments.Message: Fixed in th edevelop branch in github: it's annoying that Excel2010 supports the preserve white space attribute for rich text runs in chart labels/titles and Excel2007 doesn't, even though it's documented.
